column4: what does "RPC Program not registered" mean when i try to mount a NFS share?
most noobs nowadays have a rj45 connection to a cable modem or dsl router anyway with DHCP enabled
they dont even need to think about it
can anybody help me with my NFS connection?
so far ive set a folder to be shared, when i try to access it using autofs it doesnt know where the host is and using non-autofs, mount -t nfs sharepoint:folder.. e.t.c. brings up RPC not registered?
does anybody know of a good FTP server?
where could i get that from?
ftp does not encrypt your password at all, so it travels in plain text over the net
i dont mind, im only using it to transfer some files from one pc on the network to another
did you know synaptic has a search function?
do you have ssh servers installed? just mount the pther computer through nautilus
how do i figure if ssh is running?
sudo aptitude install openssh-server installs it through the terminal
on one of the computers, click places> connect to server...
how do i know what folder it is that i need to connect to?
